snippet: The photographs of unrest in Ferguson after the fatal shooting of an unarmed black teenager by a police officer have drawn comparisons to pictures of the Deep South in the 1960s.
abstract: Photographs that have emerged during unrest in Ferguson, Mo, following fatal shooting of black teenager Michael Brown by police officer, have drawn mournful comparisons to pictures of Deep South in 1960s or to 1992 Los Angeles riots; photos have also prompted flood of commentary about differences half a century has made in impact of media coverage and such images.

byline.original: By RANDY KENNEDY and JENNIFER SCHUESSLER

lead_paragraph: The photographs of unrest in Ferguson after the fatal shooting of an unarmed black teenager by a police officer have drawn comparisons to pictures of the Deep South in the 1960s.

headline.main: Ferguson Images Evoke Civil Rights Era and Changing Visual Perceptions
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Images Evoke Civil Rights Era and Changing Visual Perceptions
